Other Information.Additional Info: Adsorption capacity: 2.88 mmol g⁻¹ at 298 K and 1 bar.
Adsorption capacity: 1.07 mmol g⁻¹ at 298 K and 1 bar.
Adsorption capacity: 0.14 mmol g⁻¹ at 298 K and 1 bar.

Sieving Mechanism: Molecular sieving effect for i-C4H8 due to pore window size being smaller than its minimum cross-sectional size.

Experimental Validation.Method: Breakthrough experiments, static and dynamic adsorption experiments, Metropolis Monte Carlo simulations, DFT calculations
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: C4H6/i-C4H8 uptake selectivity: 20.6, 1-C4H8/i-C4H8 uptake selectivity: 7.6, Henry’s selectivities: C4H6/i-C4H8 = 521, 1-C4H8/i-C4H8 = 125.7

Other Information.Additional Info: High isosteric heat of adsorption (Qst) for C4H6 (58 kJ mol⁻¹) compared to 1-C4H8 (46 kJ mol⁻¹). Excellent durability and recyclability demonstrated through cyclic breakthrough experiments.
